content: to make the chest-part which is made in the same way as the waist/beginning part - meaning only straight row single_crochet into the first st single_crochet to the end of the row chain 1 and turn repeat this until you reach your clavicle don t fasten_off remember to leave space around your neck for the ribbed edge which will be approximately 1-2 cm also ensure that the opening of the vest is large enough for your head to comfortably pass through shaping the neck measure your neck and place two stitch markers with the same distance as the measurement positioning them in the middle of the last row of the chest part you will now decrease by the neck only for the reference vest i decreased at the neck for the next 5 row but feel free to adjust based on your preference single_crochet into the first st by the shoulder and then single_crochet across until you reach the second-to-last st skip the second-to-last st and single_crochet into the last st of the row the st with a st marker in it chain 1 turn single_crochet into the second st single_crochet across chain 1 and turn single_crochet into the first st by the shoulder single_crochet across until you reach the second-to-last st skip the second-to-last st and single_crochet into the last st of the row chain 1 turn repeat the ** section one more time or as many times as necessary for your desired shape continue by creating two more row without any decrease chain 1 and fasten_off attach the yarn on the shoulder side of the opposite side of the vest chain 1 and repeat the steps to create the other side of the neckline front panel the back panel is made in the same way as the front panel with the exception that you add two more row for the chest section and omit the last two row of the neckline the no-decrease row ensure that the number of st in the last row of the two straps of the front and back panels is the same 3 assebly and seaming attach the front and back panels together by joining the straps and sides of the vest using your preferred method i used the single_crochet st once completed turn the vest right side out border attach your yarn under the armpit and single_crochet around the hole until you come back to the first single_crochet slip_stitch into the first single_crochet chain 1 don t turn fphdc into the first st continue with fphdc and bphdc into every other st until you come back to the first st slip_stitch into the first st chain 1 don t turn make another row of fphdc and bphdc in every other st until you reach the first st slip_stitch into the last st chain 1 and fasten_off * note when
